description: The Future Hero Podcast is here as an offering of assistance in getting through this challenging world. Baxter has been teaching movement across the US and Canada for over ten years, and shares with you through his mediations and podcasts his art and experience. Listen it to you while you move.
title: FutureHero Podcast

episodes.title: Dancing in Zero Gravity (Baxter interviews Adam Dipert of The Giant Leap Project)
episodes.description: In this episode, Baxter sits down for a fascinating interview with Dr. Adam Dipert who is successfully spearheading an effort to explore dance in zero gravity. In this episode, Adam explains the many mind-blowing concepts and ideas of moving artistically in actual outer space and the surprising impacts in can (and will) have on the way we conceive of ourselves. Dr. Adam Dipert is a Particle and Astrophysicist, who is also a Co-Founder of Giant Leap, the first zero gravity dance company ever. He is also a flow and circus performer whose performances have been viewed over 1,000,000 times. Resources to find out more: www.giantleapdance.com Instagram - http://www.instagram.com/gaintleap.dance/ Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/GiantLeapDance/ Twitter - https://twitter.com/GiantLeapDance Thumbnail: Adam Dipert and Kitsou DuBois (inset) Kitsou DuBois: https://www.kitsoudubois.com If you dig the FutureHero podcast, please share, like, subscribe and rate it for us!

episodes.title: Ann asks Baxter to tell his Hoop story
episodes.description: There is a video version of this podcast on Youtube, complete with old school photos and videos. You can find in on Facebook or on Youtube. Youtube: https://youtu.be/xZlPFfTaVfw I'm back! Ann Humphreys sits down with me in studio and flips the script by asking ME the questions. Over the podcast we discuss my life with music, how I got into dance, the HoopPath, blindfolded movement, how we met, and few other surprise topics. The conversation is mix of humor, history, and philosophy. Because this is a conversation, we do not have background music. Fear not, however, this podcast is not about me, but I received so many messages asking where I have been and what I have been up to, that I decided to start back the podcast with something more personal. You can hear this podcast on all podcast platforms, including Spotify. Thank you for listening! If you want to show some Love for it, please consider giving it a like, a repost, a share, or a review on iTunes. And get ready: new meditations and episodes are on the way.

episodes.title: [Meditation] Heart Healing (Music performed live by Living Light)
episodes.description: This guided meditation focuses on the Heart and breath. It is intended to be listened to while resting or swaying (moving gently.) Special thanks to Living Light for sitting in on the keys. Music: Living Light: https://soundcloud.com/livinglight Narrator: Baxter https://soundcloud.com/jonathan-livingston-baxter The FutureHero podcast is on iTunes and almost all podcast apps. Baxter is the founder of The HoopPath. You can find out more at www.hooppath.com

episodes.title: [Meditation] Relaxation (Music performed live by Living Light)
episodes.description: This is a Relaxation meditation recorded live with Living Light on the keys. This for those of us looking to calm down and let go. Best enjoyed while resting or laying down. Narrator: Baxter Music: Living Light https://soundcloud.com/livinglight The FutureHero podcast includes nurturing episodes, live talks, conversations and meditations. If you enjoy these recordings, please consider sharing, reposting, and reviewing on iTunes and other platform apps. The more we grow, the more likely we are to continue producing work. Thank you so much to all of our supporters. www.futureheropodcast.com

episodes.title: [Ep.24] Born to Perform (w Special Guest, Spiral)
episodes.description: By request, I am creating more interviews with performers, producers, and other artistic professionals who are living a life of pursuing their dreams. In this episode, I sit down with Spiral, of spiralcircusarts.com, and discuss many topics ranging from her origin story to her use of Visualization to push her career. Spiral is without any doubt one of the founding "Mothers" of the hoop dance explosion of the early 2000's. Although she has taught flow arts, she is best known as a performer. In 2008-09, Spiral attended circus school at NECCA in Vermont to become professionally trained in several circus arts. She is currently based in Berlin, with an upcoming performance contract on the GOP Variete circuit throughout Germany. We Discuss: Her Origin Story When She Decided to go for it Persona Artistic Commitment The Highs and Lows of performing Pay vs. Exposure How she responds to setbacks **Visualization** Her thoughts on creeper guys Her Spirituality and many more things. https://www.spiralcircusarts.com https://www.facebook.com/spiralcircusarts/ As usual, thank you for your support! If you like what I do, please like, share, follow, subscribe, comment, and discuss! If you would like to suggest people to interview, you can reach me at baxter@futureheropodcast.com. If you are a musician that would like to be your music featured, please reach out with your bandcamp or Soundcloud! www.hooppath.com www.futureheropodcast.com

episodes.title: [Ep.23] On Being a Pro in Flow (w Special Guest, Ben Drexler)
episodes.description: By request, I am creating more interviews with performers, producers, and other artistic professionals who are living a life of pursuing their dreams. In this episode, I interview Ben Drexler of DrexFactor.com. Drex, as he is called in the flow world, has become a renowned performer, teacher, reviewer, and event organizer. He is considered by many a significant contributor to the flow arts world, specifically within the world of Poi. This interview is for everyone! You do not have to be in the flow world to get something from our conversation. Ben and I discuss many topics that will relate to a wide spectrum of creatives of all stripes. We discuss: His origin story His influences His take on competition His take on Ego in the flow scene His Flow practice and goal setting strategies Flow festivals (then and now) His advice for artist looking to go professional. You can find out more about Drex here: YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/drexfactor Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/drexfactor Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/drexfactorpoi Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/drexfactor Web: https://drexfactor.com As usual, thank you for your support! If you like what I do, please like, share, follow, subscribe, comment, and discuss! If you would like to suggest people to interview, you can reach me at baxter@futureheropodcast.com. If you are a musician that would like to be your music featured, please reach out with your bandcamp or Soundcloud! www.hooppath.com www.futureheropodcast.com

This episode is upbeat and perfect for moving BIG Love to Kalya Scintilla for letting me use his music! episodes.title: [Ep.20] Be Mighty, and Go Make Art (Music by DRRTYWULVZ)
episodes.description: C'mon, Artists, we need you to bring it. We need your crazy take on all this crazy ____ going on right now. In this episode, I share a little advice on making the best art you can and avoiding common traps that lead to ruts and disengagement. BIG THANKS to DRRTYWULVZ for letting me use his new, dope release! episodes.title: [Ep.19] Cleaning, Clearing, and Creativity (Music by Chase Miles)
episodes.description: Clutter and dirt are a total drag on your creative flow. In this upbeat episode, Baxter offers his take on the self-care of keeping your "house" clean and optimized for your creativity and flow. This podcast is good for almost any setting, but it is ideally intended for those people who want some supportive companionship while they (hopefully cheerfully) clean things up externally and internally. HUGE Thanks to Chase Miles for letting me use his AMAZING music! Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/chasemilesmusic SETLIST: 1 Chase Miles — Sentient (video in description) 2 Chase Miles — You Make Me Float 3. Chase Miles — Jonah Complex (Off of From Janky to Swanky, August 11) 4 Old Tacoma Records — Chase Miles - Bout That 5 Old Tacoma Records — Chase Miles - Swank 6 Old Tacoma Records — Chase Miles - Oh 7 Old Tacoma Records — Chase Miles - Jank 8 Old Tacoma Records — Chase Miles - Paws 9 Old Tacoma Records — Chase Miles - AWW YEA 10 Chase Miles — Go 11 Chase Miles — Formula 12 Chase Miles — Oh My Gawd Play 13 Chase Miles — SWV - You're The One (Chase Miles R You can subscribe to FutureHero Podcast on iTunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/futurehero-podcast/id1082878677?mt=2 If you like what I do, please share, repost, like, or rate! www.hooppath.com

episodes.title: [Ep.18] When You're not Feeling the Holidays (Music by Spoken Bird)
episodes.description: This week, I discuss the "dark mood" some of us feel around the holidays and how we can deal with it, move on and actually have a good time hanging with friends, family, and tribe. You can find "The FutureHero Podcast" on iTunes, Stitcher, and most podcast platforms. Big Thanks to Spoken Bird! Your music it pure get down! episodes.title: [Ep. 17] Reclaiming Yourself after an Election Loss (*NEW* Music:  Subaqueous, and In The Branches)
episodes.description: By Request: Four listeners wrote to me this morning asking if I would speak to the election results and offer some comfort to those who are troubled by the turn of events. In this episode I share my feelings of grief and offer ways to find meaning in all of it. (This is a peaceful approach and is not meant to create further divisions.) Big thanks to Shane Cotee "In The Branches" for the opening track "Finding Peace" off the brand new: As Real As a Dream Bandcamp: https://theadaptive.bandcamp.com/album/as-real-as-a-dream Special thanks to Isaac Cotec and "Subaqueous" for providing this music. The music in this podcast is the *BRAND NEW* release from Subaqueous, "SlipStream." I omitted one song due to episode length. Bandcamp: https://subaqueous.bandcamp.com/album/slipstream Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/subaqueousmusic

episodes.title: [Ep.16] How to Stay in Tune with the Real You (*New* Music by Living Light)
episodes.description: Even the most expensive violin in the world can become out of tune. Americans want to stay in tune 24/7. It never works out. This episode is about embracing the reality that we all need tuning no matter how perfect we want to live. Music by Living Light Bandcamp link to EP: https://livinglightmusic.bandcamp.com/album/tales-from-the-karman-line-2-atmospheres Soundcloud link: https://soundcloud.com/livinglight

episodes.title: [Ep.15] Come out, Come out, Wherever You Are (DJ mix from Lucky)
episodes.description: Be who you are. They can love you or hate you for it, but it doesn't change anything. This is your life to live. If you want to support me, share this, like this, follow this, or whatever. Your online support is what I need the most right now. This podcast is available on iTunes, Stitcher, and most podcast platforms. Music is by: Lucky (luckyburns): https://soundcloud.com/luckyburns Direct link to mix: https://soundcloud.com/luckyburns/lucky-pex-summer-festival-7-4-2014

episodes.title: [Ep. 14] Peace in Action (Music by The Adaptive)
episodes.description: Enough with the war and fight talk in today's social landscape. It's not helping. In this podcast, I offer ways that we can bring peace into our lives in everything we do. I do my best to inspire us to give peace a chance to do its work and bring us into new day. If you want to support me, share this, like this, follow this, or whatever. Your online support is what I need the most right now. This podcast is available on iTunes, Stitcher, and most podcast platforms. Thank you to Shane Cotee for letting me use his music. The Adaptive: https://soundcloud.com/theadaptive In The Branches: https://soundcloud.com/inthebranches Bandcamp: https://theadaptive.bandcamp.com Setlist: 1. Duality (with Kevin Tool) 04:59 5. Inner City Cabin Fever 05:57 6. Black Sea Coast 06:03 7. Paula Aladeen 04:25 8. Places You Been 06:14

episodes.title: [Ep.13] Re-Entry:  From Ideality to Reality (Music: The Human Experience)
episodes.description: So you're home from a big moment of your life, now what? Coming home from a big event can be a mixed bag of feelings and thoughts. In this episode, I offer up my thoughts on making your re-entry from ideality to reality as impactful as possible. And less icky. If you want to support me, share this, like this, follow this, or whatever. Your online support is what I need the most right now. This podcast is available on iTunes, Stitcher, and most podcast platforms. episodes.title: [Ep.12] Let's Go to Burning Man
episodes.description: Every year, I get asked, so here it is in podcast form: My Advice on preparing for and enjoying Burning Man. I offer this as gentle advice and encouragement for those people headed to playa this year. I am just one man with one opinion and I have no delusions that I am an expert of all things Burning Man. I recorded this with idea that people might listen to it while packing for the Burn, or driving to it, or flying into Reno. If you have never attended BM, you may enjoy listening, anyway, because I try to explain the event and it's vibe. If you want to support me, share this, like this, follow this, or whatever. Your online support is what I need the most right now. This podcast is available on iTunes, Stitcher, and most podcast platforms. The Setlist: (Thank you to all of the musicians who have given me permission to use their beautiful music. 1. Subaqueous — Moment a Myth (Free Download) 2. Moon Frog — Numatik - Gaia Unfolding (Moon Frog Remix) 3. Living Light — Cloud Seed 4. Ayla Nereo — Ayla Nereo - Hollow Bone Remixes - Show Yourself (Living Light remix) 5. AtYyA — Emanating (Hakuu Remix) 10. In The Branches — Imprint 11. DEEPSØNØS by HÄANA — DEEPSØNØS - Episode II Ephemére

episodes.title: [ep.11] The Unfettered Now (Music by Rakja)
episodes.description: **Content advisory: I discuss Orlando for the first 5 minutes, then begin the podcast.** Baxter shares how Awareness changed his life and movement practice and how he believes it could help you, as well. This week's podcast is movement friendly and upbeat. The book title Baxter could not remember in the podcast is "The Unfettered Mind: Writings from a Zen Master to a Sword Master." Music by Rakja (Super Big Thanks to you, my friend!) Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/rakjamusic Setlist: 1. Eastern Peak 2. Third Civilization 3. Mana Fest 4. "REM" State Support: Your likes, shares, reposts, and follows really help! Please consider reviewing us on iTunes, as well. Financial support is appreciated and can be given at: PayPal.Me/baxterpodcast FutureHero is also available for subscription through iTunes at: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/futurehero-podcast/id1082878677?mt=2

episodes.description: Baxter, with the music of Moon Frog, explains a few ways we can bring Love into this world to chill out all the hostility and get back to civility. Music: Moon Frog Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/moonfrog Setlist: 1. Moon Frog — Future Passed 2. Moon Frog — The Letter 3. Moon Frog — Whittled Horse 4. Moon Frog — First Age 5. episodes.description: Baxter answers questions from listeners about his life, his work, and his beliefs. Questions: 1. Who am I? 2. How do I make this podcast? 3. Why do I make this podcast? 4. What are my thoughts on HB2? 5. What do *I* actually believe in spiritually? (Music from "Ecliptic ReVisions- The Remixes)Various Artists Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/livinglight Setlist: 1. episodes.title: [Ep.8] Movement Makes You Better at Everything (Music by Bird of Prey)
episodes.description: Want to do something positive today? Dance with me for 30 minutes. In this podcast, we get down and move for 30 solid minutes to "Bird of Prey." I try to open your way into the flow state as I explain some of the benefits of a consistent movement practice. THANK YOU, Bird of Prey!! Soundcloud: Bird of Prey: https://soundcloud.com/bird-of-prey Birds of Paradise: https://soundcloud.com/birdsofparadise If you would like to submit your music, hit me up at baxter@futureheropodcast.com or dm on Soundcloud. FutureHero is also available on iTunes, Sticher, and most pod-platforms.

episodes.title: [Special] Delivering Emotional Letters of Love for the Grieving  (Soundtrack: DEEPSØNØS by HÄANA)
episodes.description: (Warning: This is an emotional and deeply personal message. It contains issues concerning grief and the loss of loved ones.) While I intended to make a "Meditation" recording today, my preparation led me to my own profound experience and prompted me to speak about two very significant moments in my life. This is my heartfelt attempt to share and, perhaps, deliver two messages I have received over the last 12 years. Soundtrack: DEEPSØNØS by HÄANA SoundCloud: DEEPSØNØS: @deepsonos HÄANA: @thisishaana Cover photo: 2004 Temple by David West --Photo by Bill Kositzky This is special message from Baxter, of the FutureHero Podcast

episodes.title: [Ep.7]  How to Create Your Future World (Music By Sun)
episodes.description: Our FutureHero is calling us into a future world, but what does that world look like? This week we venture on a journey of visualization of the world in which we want to create. Special thanks to "Sun" for sharing your music for this episode. It's beautiful. Music by "Sun" Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/stepstothesun Set List: 1. Sun — 01 First Step 2. Sun — 02 When We Pass 3. Sun — 03 Reside Inside 4. Sun — 04 All That There Is 5. Sun — 05 Reckoning 6. Sun — Golden Seas 7. Sun — Meet The Maker 8. Sun — Life Forever Your support means a lot. If you like this, please consider liking, sharing, or following. FutureHero is available on Soundcloud, iTunes, Stitcher and most podcasts platforms. The music is generously donated by the artists. Please check out their channels!

episodes.title: [Special] Brecken Rivara interview
episodes.description: A special interview with hoop dance pioneer, Brecken Rivara. Brecken Rivara is considered by many to be one of the most creative and innovative hoopers of the modern hoop dance era. She is a professional hoop dance teacher who has traveled the world teaching her unique blend of dance, technique, and exploration. In this interview, Baxter and Brecken discuss the culture of hooping's past and present. Brecken reveals who really came up with the smear, and her take on hooping and social media. FutureHero Podcast is on Soundcloud, iTunes, Stitcher and many more platforms. Please consider liking and sharing if you dig, what we do.

episodes.title: [Ep.6] How to Chill out and Save the World  (Music by Hakuu)
episodes.description: Baxter chills us out then explains why and how we should stay that way. Music generously provided by: Hakuu on Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/hakuu (BIG Love!) Set list is in comments and below. If you are a musician and would like to submit your music for this podcast, just send me your soundcloud or band camp to baxter@futureheropodcast.com (Thanks for all the likes, shares, reposts, etc. It means the world to me to find an audience.) episodes.title: [Episdode 5] "This Is Your Moment/Go Get It" (Music by Kaminanda)
episodes.description: It's time to get going on your vision. This is a high energy episode great for moving, running, and driving. Music by Kaminanda. Album: The Infinite Breath https://soundcloud.com/kaminanda FutureHero Podcast: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/futurehero-podcast/id1082878677?mt=2

episodes.title: [Special Talk] "How To Deal with Opposite People" (Baxter Live from Calgary- Sunday Circle Talk)
episodes.description: How do we handle people that disagree with us? In this live talk from Calgary, Baxter discusses how we deals with an American politician. He also finishes the story of how he fell in love. I am on tour right now! We will resume our normal episodes soon!

episodes.title: [Special Talk] "Imagining Confidence" -Baxter talk- Live From Calgary (Edited)
episodes.description: Baxter delivered this talk at HP: Calgary. Baxter is speaking to a group of 40+ hoop dancers, sitting in a circle. Unfortunately, some of the comments from the group are hard to hear. This will be corrected in the future. Baxter begins every class and workshop with an opening improvised talk. In this talk, he discusses how one can find and gain confidence through the use of their imaginations.

episodes.title: [Episode 4] "You're Not Stupid" (Music By Desert Dwellers)
episodes.description: You're not stupid. You may be fixated, though. In this episode, I explain how becoming and being fixated can lead us to make bad decisions. The music is upbeat and meant to get you through your movement session, while I attempt to help us break the pull of our current fixations and be free up a "sticky Awareness." The music is by Desert Dwellers. Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/desertdwellers Track: https://soundcloud.com/desertdwellers/desert-dwellers-live-2015-earth-heart-tour (If you would like to have your music featured, please email me your info at baxter@fututreheropodcast.com) FutureHero Podcast is available on iTunes, Stitcher, Soundcloud and many other platforms.

episodes.title: [Meditation] Breath and Surrender (Music by AmmonEP)
episodes.description: Tranquility by way of humility. This weeks' meditation focuses on surrendering to the Universe, rather than fighting against it. While it is true that we make our own way in this world, it is also true that things happen to us that are beyond our control. Embracing the intended and the unintended creates space for Understanding and Compassion for ourselves, and for others. Music by AmmonEP: "Encounter" https://soundcloud.com/ammonep Words: Jonathan Livingston Baxter www.futureheropodcast.com Available across all platforms: iTunes, Stitcher, Soundcould.

episodes.title: [Episode 3] FutureHero "When You Outgrow Your Shell"   (music By AtYyA)
episodes.description: This week's episode is all about freeing up the flow of who you really are by letting go of the one thing we sometimes hold to the tightest: our identity. Baxter explains his take on making our way out of being stuck, by freeing ourselves from the shells of who we used to be. Music: AtYya Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/atyya Mix used: Eternally Blessed Mix 2015 • AtYyA - Circularium • AtYyA & Goopsteppa - Nocturnal • Ayla Nereo - Let It In (AtYyA Remix) • AtYyA - Sublingual • AtYyA - Altar Form (DRRTYWULVZ Remix) • AtYyA & Goopsteppa - Nova Soundcloud link: https://soundcloud.com/atyya/eternally-blessed-mix-2015?in=atyya/sets/atyya-dj-mixes Cover photo by: Tania Marie https://taniamarieartist.wordpress.com/tag/snake-skin-symbolism/ iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/futurehero-podcast/id1082878677?mt=2 Also available on Stitcher.

episodes.title: [Meditation] "Neither Sword, Nor Shield"(Music by The Human Experience)
episodes.description: In this meditation, we are seeking to align our selves with peacefulness. The world can be such an angry place, and it is easy to become swept up in hostility for those with whom we do not agree. Yet, agreement with all peoples, is not prerequisite to Love for all peoples. Listening can cultivate understanding, and understanding can bridge great divides between hearts without detriment to either party. To be in peace, is to be more open to life and its many lessons. Music by The Human Experience Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/thehumanexperience Bandcamp: https://thehumanexperience.bandcamp.com Songs used: "Butterfly, The metamorphosis" "Dusty Rose" "Beads of the Wind" Spoken word: Baxter www.futureheropodcast.com iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/futurehero-podcast/id1082878677?mt=2 Artwork: Steinunn Þórarinsdóttir Donate: PayPal.Me/baxterpodcast

episodes.title: [Episode 2] FutureHero  "The Authentic Hero" (Music by Subaqueous)
episodes.description: "Our Authenticity is our faithfulness to our Truth." In this episode, Baxter explains his take on what it means to be Authentic and how being in Authenticity is its own practice. Also, Baxter shares how this podcast got its title, and what 'spirituality' means to him. Music by Subaqueous "Invoking" on Immerge https://subaqueous.bandcamp.com/track/invoking The album, "ReCreate" https://subaqueous.bandcamp.com/ SubAqueous Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/subaqueousmusic FutureHero iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/futurehero-podcast/id1082878677?mt=2 Donation Link: PayPal.Me/baxterpodcast

episodes.title: [Meditation] "Openness" (Music by Moon Frog)
episodes.description: "Openness" mediation Music by Moon Frog Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/moonfrog Mediation by Jonathan Livingston Baxter A meditation for being in Openness. (Yoga, Sway pace)

episodes.title: [Episode 1] FutureHero  "Belief, Strength, Grace" (Music by Living Light)
episodes.description: In Episode 1 “Belief, Strength, Grace” Baxter explains the purpose of the FutureHero Podcast, how it is intended to help and be enjoyed. This debut episode recording is intended to provide some background into Baxter and his work teaching movement over the last 10 years. The featured subject of this episode is the explanation of Baxter’s “Belief, Strength, Grace” progression. The best way to enjoy this podcast is to put it on while you’re moving or getting things done. Music is played throughout to keep you motivated and going forward as you reflect on the information shared. www.futureheropodcast.com Music by Living Light The original set can be found here: https://soundcloud.com/livinglight/live-at-cosmic-convergence-2016-2-hour-new-years-day-sunrise-set The FutureHero Podcast is made possible by the generosity of others. If you would like to donate, please click this link: PayPal.Me/baxterpodcast Music Submissions are always welcomed! If you would like your music featured, please send me links to your music at baxter@futureheropodcast.com

episodes.title: [Meditation] "Channeling the Unstoppable Power of the Human Heart" (Music by Amani Friend & Psylab)
episodes.description: This is a mellow meditation meant to center you. (Sway or Yoga pace.) Part 1. Music "Vajra Mind (Meditative Soundscapes compiled by Amani Friend.)" Amani Friend is 1/2 of Desert Dwellers. Part 2. Music "Venus in Libra" by Psylab on the album, "Cardinal Alignment." The podcast is made possible by donations. Thank you. Meditations are released every Sunday. Full podcasts are released every Wednesday.
